parse.title: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. (Blome sculpture)

text.*:
Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
Artist Erik Blome
Year 1998
Type bronze
Dimensions 290 cm (114 in)
Location Milwaukee, Wisconsin
Coordinates 43°03′12″N 87°54′51″W﻿ / ﻿43.053359°N 87.914109°W﻿ / 43.053359; -87.914109Coordinates: 43°03′12″N 87°54′51″W﻿ / ﻿43.053359°N 87.914109°W﻿ / 43.053359; -87.914109
Owner YWCA of Greater Milwaukee

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. is a public art work designed by American artist Erik Blome, located in downtown Milwaukee, Wisconsin.[1] The bronze sculpture depicts the civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. standing on a pedestal of books. It was commissioned by the YWCA of Greater Milwaukee and is located in front of the King Heights apartments.[2]

See also[edit]

  • Children of the West End
  • Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. (Dwight sculpture), Houston, Texas
  • Martin Luther King Jr. (University of Texas at Austin)
  • Martin Luther King Jr. (Wilson sculpture), Washington, D.C.

References[edit]

  1. ^ Owen J. Dwyer and, Derek Alderman (2008). Civil rights memorials and the geography of memory. Athens: University of Georgia Press. p. 24. ISBN 1-930066-71-6. 
  2. ^ Jacobs, Jodie (1 March 1998). "A big man". Chicago Tribune. Retrieved 28 December 2011.
